unit: Unit 4 | Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
title: Geometric Distribution Shape
question_text: The shape of a geometric distribution

choices.text: Depends on $P$, the probability of success.
Will be symmetric but not necessarily normal.

solution:
A geometric distribution will always be right skewed. Regardless of the probability of success, the single most likely outcome will be success on the first trial. For each additional value ($n = 2, n = 3$, etc.), there will be a slightly lower probability of success on that trial.

Thus, the correct answer is Choice 'B'.
